newsitem.title: GERMANY: Kohl says Germany must stick to EMU target date.
newsitem.headline: Kohl says Germany must stick to EMU target date.

text.p: German Chancellor Helmut Kohl said on Sunday it was important that European Economic and Monetary Union start punctually on January 1 1999.
Kohl said in the Frankfurter Allgemeine Sonntagszeitung that EMU was important for European competitiveness.
"Even if we delay, keeping to a new start-up date will not be any easier," adding that budgetary and social reform would be necessary "with or without the euro."
Speaking on Friday at a conference in Bad Homburg, told of the importance of building the "House of Europe" and said that 1997 was a key year for Europe.
If the house was not built now, it would not be built in ten or fifteen years time either, he said.

Kohl reiterated his desire to include central and eastern European nations in European Union, on condition that the aspiring members could afford to join and that not all states who wanted to join would immediately become full members.
Turning to scepticism about Europe in Britain and its unwillingness to join currency union, Kohl said he respected each country's history.
He said that European Union with Britain "would only be a torso" and said he believed that when EMU happens, that Britain too would ultimately join the union.
